page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT
page.content:
A barn nearby could well be the Grange mentioned in the Domesday Survey of 1085.
There are thirty families living in the village. Some of the men work on Berry farm and some work on the Duke's estate, but most men travel out of the village to work. Living in the village is the transport manager for Unigate Dairies, the fuel oil manager for South Western Farmers, the shop manager for Harris's Bacon factory, a milkman, a cafe owner, a timber yard employee, and a policeman. Some of the women are employed in the farmhouse, and some at the village school - a teacher, two dinner ladies, a secretary, and a caretaker.
